Posts.EditableText: This is in relation to TrOn's reponse on my question about maps. I'm sorry, but you are going to have to bear with me as I am very new to this. When you say make a small program, exactly what do you mean and where can I learn more about how to accomplish that? Thank you in advance for your assistance. Dr. Froth
Posts.HTML:
This is in relation to TrOn's reponse on my question about maps.

I'm sorry, but you are going to have to bear with me as I am very new to this. When you say make a small program, exactly what do you mean and where can I learn more about how to accomplish that?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Dr. Froth

Posts.EditableText: I believe he meant rather than program the map into your  current game file, start up a new file and test it there. That way you don't have to sort through all the other stuff in your game, and problems are easier to find.
Posts.HTML: I believe he meant rather than program the map into your  current game file, start up a new file and test it there. That way you don't have to sort through all the other stuff in your game, and problems are easier to find.

Posts.EditableText:
No - I meant go get a proper compiler and create a simple program to bring up an image/text-layout of the map.

Pretty simple actually, and you have alot more control as it's your program.

Posts.EditableText: Gnu C++, through Linux - or you can get mingw.. I personally just download Bloodshed's Dev-C++(http://www.bloodshed.net/). Has a good repository from what I can see, and pretty easy to use! Nice development GUI for C++ too. But I understand you can use notepad with mingw stuff - I just haven't been bothered to learn anything about the command line configuration in Windows.. Bloody nightmare compared to Linux/Unix.
Posts.HTML:
Gnu C++, through Linux - or you can get mingw.. I personally just download Bloodshed's Dev-C++(http://www.bloodshed.net/).

Has a good repository from what I can see, and pretty easy to use!
Nice development GUI for C++ too.

But I understand you can use notepad with mingw stuff - I just haven't been bothered to learn anything about the command line configuration in Windows.. Bloody nightmare compared to Linux/Unix.
